intro: Iris regelii, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright, sword-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals, blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a hardy addition to gardens in colder climates. Iris regelii is valued for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
